snippet: The Nobel Prize in Literature, whose winner will be announced early Thursday, goes annually to “the most outstanding work of an idealistic tendency.”
abstract: Dwight Garner looks at potential winners of the 2014 Nobel Prize in Literature; British gambling website Ladbrokes has said the top three candidates for the award are Kenyan novelist Ngugi wa Thiong'o, Japanese writer Haruki Murakami and Belarussian journalist Svetlana Alexievich.
lead_paragraph: The Nobel Prize in Literature, whose winner will be announced early Thursday, goes annually to “the most outstanding work of an idealistic tendency.”

headline.print_headline: The Nobel Prize Waiting Game: A Year for Long Shots?
headline.seo: The Nobel Prize in Literature: A Year for Long Shots?
headline.main: The Nobel Prize Waiting Game: A Year for Long Shots?
